overview_of_class: Students will analyze the aesthetics, themes, and sociocultural contexts of slapstick, gross-out, animated, and surrealist comedy across a broad history of media texts from early silent film comedy through present day feature films and television series, which variously represent the body as a site of pleasure, transgression, disgust, and humiliation. Through a series of reading and writing assignments, students will develop critical approaches to comedy, and specifically physical comedy, that variously emphasize class, gender, race, stardom, modernity, theories of humor, and paradigms of taste.
